document_title: Warts on hands (fingers): Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Warts on the hands usually do not cause adverse symptoms to the body. But in some cases, patients should see a doctor for examination and treatment. Hand wart conditions that require seeing a doctor include:
Warts on hands cause pain and tenderness; The color of the wart changes from the original appearance; Warts on the hands bleed, have pus or crust; People with diabetes, HIV, etc. have warts on their hands; Warts appear on the hands and then spread to other parts of the body such as: genitals, mouth, nostrils.
subsection_title: mun coc o tay.json. When to see a doctor?
